image.altText: a gorup of people marching, a woman holds up a sign that says no more

props.synopsis: The government has announced a five-year, $925 million package that will include the Leave Program, offering financial support and safety to people looking to escape domestic violence. Follow live.

title.children: Funding announced to support survivors of domestic violence, combat male extremist views online

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What about male victims of domestic violence?
Unpacking the government's plan to tackle online male extremist views
Watch: The PM announce new measures to combat domestic violence

image.altText: Actor David Gulpilil, an older Yolngu man in shearling coat taking off his akubra, in the documentary My Name is Gulpilil

props.synopsis: Before his death, David Gulpilil had been longing to get back to Arnhem Land. Now, a new film captures his final journey home.

title.children: 'This is as honest as it's gonna get': Documentary captures late film star's traditional funeral

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with Micaela Cronin.

props.synopsis: At a national cabinet meeting addressing the gendered violence crisis, the federal government commits more than $900 million for a program supporting women leaving violence, and a suite of online measures to combat online misogyny and young people viewing pornography.Â

title.children: The government has committed $1bn to combat the violence against women crisis. Here's what we know

image.altText: Bruce Lehrman leaves the Federal Court of Australia in Sydney 150424

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Network Ten will argue this afternoon that they should be awarded indemnity costs after Bruce Lehrmann lost his defamation battle in the Federal Court earlier this month.

title.children: Network Ten goes for top costs as Bruce Lehrmann's 'deliberately wicked' defamation case returns to court

image.altText: a woman in a hospital bed taking a selfie

props.synopsis: Medical bills examined by experts reveals how Australian chronic pain sufferers are being apparently billed for fictitious services, inflated costs, and treatments for conditions they don't have.

title.children: 'I feel violated, I trusted them': Patients appalled after being shown the true nature of their medical bills

image.altText: Rubbish is strewn across the grass

props.synopsis: A pool lined with green sludge, rotting roofs and termite infested buildings â this derelict island resort has become a sad tourist attraction for all the wrong reasons, and it's not an isolated case.

title.children: Once a mecca for the rich and famous, these island resorts now lie in ruins

image.altText: A Qantas jumbo takes off

props.synopsis: Qantas resolves an issue with its app that allowed customers to view the details of other passengers, including names and upcoming flight plans.

title.children: Qantas fixes data breach, 'not a cyber incident'

image.altText: People with suitcases using computer terminals at an airport with a Qantas sign behind them

props.synopsis: Qantas says it has resolved an issue with its app after passengers reported they could access other customers' details, while the Australian share market is trading lower after heavy losses on Wall Street overnight. Follow live.Â

title.children: Qantas says 'no indication' of a cyber security incident as app issue resolves, local share market down

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Sufficient justification': Rabobank forecasts two rate hikes this year
ASX down by 1.1pc at lunch as tech stocks sink
Cost of living surges most for workers as more people slip off cheap fixed mortgages

image.altText: An illustration of a line of silhouetted people walking along a DNA spiral.

props.synopsis: Prenatal testing means some genetic conditions, like Down syndrome, can be identified in utero. But experts say it raises complex and challenging questions about how we value people with disabilities.

title.children: In Iceland, there are almost no babies born with Down syndrome. It's raised concerns from disability advocates

image.altText: Canberra gendered violence rally

props.synopsis: The footage of Anthony Albanese at a gendered violence rally outside Parliament House is nearly unwatchable. How can a political leader â whose entire skill set is supposed to be about competent judgement under fire â get it so horribly wrong?

title.children: 'I am the prime minister' should never be uttered by anyone. Albanese chose the worst possible moment

image.altText: Jo Harten holds a netball in both hands

props.synopsis: Netball Australia is already embracing changes to their traditional playing dress, but the Super Netball clubs are yet to take up the offer. Giants co-captain Jo Harten says she is pushing hard to make it happen.

title.children: 'I'd be brave enough to change': Super Netball captain hoping to ditch the dress

image.altText: A colourful graphic featuring a TV icon, a teen girl, a remote, and ABC, SBS, Nine, Seven, Netflix, Disney+ and other logos.

props.synopsis: Ratings data shows young people are turning away from traditional TV in droves in favour of streaming platforms and social media. But an expert says free-to-air television still has a role, and Australia does have a choice about its media future.

title.children: In the age of streaming and social media, do we still need free-to-air TV?

image.altText: an outside view of a row of houses

props.synopsis: Property prices surged once again in April due the ongoing shortage of housing and rising demand. Could the rise of the YIMBY â or the "yes in my back yard" â movement be the solution to boosting the supply of affordable housing?

title.children: 'I want the best in my backyard': Why generations don't see eye to eye on boosting housing supply

image.altText: a child next to a sign saying 'stand with larrakia people, save lee point'

props.synopsis: Protesters have attempted to disrupt bulldozingÂ at the controversial Defence housing project at Lee Point in Darwin, which has long been opposed by community activists and traditional owners.

title.children: Protesters arrested, crowds gather as bulldozers clear trees at Top End Defence housing development

image.altText: An aerial view of suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Data from CoreLogic shows house prices rising for the 15th straight month in April. Here's what property prices look like across the country.

title.children: House prices have risen for the 15th month in a row. Here's what property values look like across the country

image.altText: Steve Smith in Australia's ODI kit

props.synopsis: Steve Smith is left out of an Australian World Cup squad for the first time since 2012 as Australia's 15-man provisional squad is named.

title.children: 'Tailored approach': Smith axed as Australia unveils T20 World Cup squad

image.altText: Cash being handed away by an elderly person

props.synopsis: What if the government was doing everything it could to stop thieves making off with our money, except the one thing that could really work?

title.children: Could new rules in the UK help solve Australia's scam crisis?

image.altText: Cyborg girl

props.synopsis: While artificial intelligence promises to make life easier, the technology is already affecting our mental health and understanding of reality, warns one neuroscientist.

title.children: Fear killer robots? This expert believes you should be more worried about what AI is doing to your mind

image.altText: Keegan Payne kisses a barra

props.synopsis: Million Dollar Fish is an annual NT fishing competition where localsÂ and tourists vie for barramundi tagged for big prize money.

title.children: 'This is crazy': Top End teen awarded $1m after reeling in prized fish

image.altText: A grey short-hair cat sits on an open laptop on a home office desk.

props.synopsis: A lot of biological matter â skin cells, bacteria, hairs â are shed by people every day, many taking up residence in our home office.

title.children: The dirtiest item in your home office and how to clean it

image.altText: plane on tarmac with man walking down

props.synopsis: A federal minister says a bailout for airline Bonza is "not something that the government has before us" after the carrier went into voluntary administration.

title.children: Bonza fleet grounded for days as passengers scramble for flights

image.altText: A long shot of an empty hotel corridor, with doors running along either side.

props.synopsis: Victoria's workplace safety watchdog says it is "deeply disappointed", after prosecutors dropped dozens of charges laid against the state government over its ill-fated COVID-19 hotel quarantine program.

title.children: Bid to prosecute Victorian government over COVID-19 hotel quarantine failures collapses in court

image.altText: An urgent care centre

props.synopsis: Staff at Colac Area Health posed as patients to make its urgent care ward look busy during a visit from the health minister. At least one ambulance was also arranged to arrive during the visit.

title.children: Regional Victorian hospital staff used ambulance and posed as patients in elaborate ruse during minister's visit

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: During a pre-trial hearing for murder accused Rajwinder Singh, the Supreme Court hears that 24-year-old Toyah Cordingley had started a secret relationship with her podiatrist in the weeks before her death and believed her partner knew "something was off".

title.children: Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley in secret relationship before her alleged murder, court hears

image.altText: Three women protesting outside NSW parliament house in support of trans rights

props.synopsis: A protester interrupts the Archbishop of Sydney less than a minute after he had begun comments over his concerns over legislation designed to provide greater protections to transgender people in New South Wales.

title.children: Archbishop interrupted by protester less than a minute into giving evidence at NSW transgender inquiry

image.altText: Two men standing in front of a green shed.

props.synopsis: Bushfire detection cameras that use artificial intelligence to recognise smoke are being installed at some Australian fire towers. They are replacing human fire spotters, scanning the horizon 24 hours a day.Â

title.children: Fire towers have long relied on humans sitting and waiting with binoculars. Now AI is taking over

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court resumes today to consider costs in Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson over coverage of Brittany Higgins's rape allegation.

title.children: Federal Court to consider costs in Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson

image.altText: Jason Demetrius speaking to the media.

props.synopsis: The Rabbitohs say they have no regrets about terminating Jason Demetriou's contract in the wake of the club's disastrous start to the NRL season.

title.children: 'Time to make the change': Rabbitohs defend decision to sack Demetriou as coach

image.altText: A women's soccer team wearing green uniforms walks out under a red banner gesturing to their heads

props.synopsis: FIFA threatens the country with suspensionÂ amid accusations of money laundering and "undue influence by third parties" within its federation.Â

title.children: Matildas' Olympic opponents Zambia could be disqualified from Games

image.altText: Bayley Turner, a trans woman, smiles brightly in front of a yellow background. She has her arms folded in front of her.

props.synopsis: In the wake of the #MeToo movement, intimacy coordinators including Bayley Turner have become fundamental to stage and screen productions.

title.children: Bayley grew up watching Neighbours. Now she's working on the show as their intimacy coordinator

image.altText: Composite image of Kendrick Lamar and Drake performing live

props.synopsis: The internet weighs in on rap's biggest feud asÂ Kendrick Lamar drops Euphoria â a six-minute take-down of Drake.

title.children: The best reacts to Kendrick Lamar hitting back at Drake in new six-minute diss track

image.altText: Men and women in an F1 garage look on with concern, with one woman biting her sunglasses

props.synopsis: Formula 1 suffered a catastrophe in 1994 when the sport lost two drivers on the same race weekend. While the legendary Ayrton Senna took most of the spotlight,Â Roland Ratzenberger's legacy lives on through F1's safety innovations.

title.children: Thirty years on from F1's darkest weekend, the deaths of Senna and Ratzenberger have left a legacy of safety

image.altText: A close up shot of a sold sign outside of a property in the Albany Suburb of Mira mar

props.synopsis: Surprisingly strong inflation, but exceptionally weak retail spending, has major bank economists predicting the Reserve Bank won't cut interest rates until November.

title.children: Big four banks warn first rate cut won't come until November, as 'incredibly strong' migration makes the RBA's task 'more difficult'

image.altText: A group of scientists in the lab focusing on something that's obstructed in the foreground.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide research team has identified precise biomarkers for prostate cancer, making it easier to predict how the disease could progress with the hope it will lead to more accurate treatment.

title.children: Australian researchers identify precise prostate cancer biomarkers in âgroundbreakingâ research

image.altText: A profile image of a woman with long, ice blonde hair. She has a slight smile on her face.

props.synopsis: About aÂ week after 28-year-old Molly Ticehurst was allegedly killed by her former partner, her family want urgent law reforms that would include monitoring devices for alleged domestic violence offenders.

title.children: Family and friends of Molly Ticehurst call for 'Molly's Law' to better protect people from domestic violence
